(Sac & Fox Nation of Missouri in Kansas and Nebraska)
Its Treaty between the United States of America and the Confederated Tribes of Sac & Fox Indians. Concluded Sept. 28, 1836. Ratified Feb. 27, 1837, 1837.
Sac and Fox Nation of Missouri in Kansas and Nebraska, WWW site, May 22, 2006:

Tribal History (Treaty of 1815 officially named Sac and Fox Nation of Missouri as distinct tribe and they were removed to northeastern Missouri from Iowa and Illinois; 1824 removed to Platte Valley northwest of Missouri River; Treaty of 1837 removed the Sac and Fox Nation of Missouri to Kansas across the Missouri River to the Great Nemaha reservation in Doniphan and Brown counties; became officially known as the Sac and Fox Nation of Missouri in Kansas and Nebraska)
Sac & Fox Nation of Missouri in Kansas and Nebraska
